description: Time series dataset tracking the relationship between Vietnam's primary school enrollment and GDP from 2001 to 2020
source: World Bank Data (assumed based on typical economic and education statistics)

columns.notes: Automatically generated index from pandas DataFrame; can be ignored or used as record identifier
Primary temporal key for the dataset

columns.description: Total number of students enrolled in primary education in Vietnam
columns.notes: Represents the total count of children enrolled in primary schools (typically ages 6-11) across Vietnam. Shows a general declining trend from 2001-2010, followed by gradual recovery.

Vietnam's GDP in current US dollars. Shows consistent growth throughout the period, with GDP increasing more than 10-fold from 2001 to 2020. Represents the total monetary value of all goods and services produced in Vietnam.

key_observations: Primary enrollment decreased from ~9.75 million (2001) to ~6.75 million (2009), then gradually recovered to ~8.72 million (2020)
GDP showed consistent growth from ~$32.7 billion (2001) to ~$343.2 billion (2020)
The decline in primary enrollment may reflect demographic changes (declining birth rates) rather than reduced access to education
GDP growth was sustained even during periods of declining primary enrollment
potential_analyses: Correlation analysis between GDP growth and primary enrollment trends
Time series forecasting for future enrollment and GDP values
Investigation of inverse relationship between economic growth and enrollment decline
Per-student GDP calculation as a proxy for education investment capacity
